brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate anthropometric, metabolic, cardiovascular and
      symptomatic profiles in postmenopausal women.

clinical_study.brief_title: Anthropometric, Metabolic, Cardiovascular and Symptomatic Profile in Postmenopausal Women

detailed_description.textblock:
When aging, the body composition changes, leading to a reduction of muscle mass and
      strength, and to an increase in total body fat. These body composition changes have
      especially been observed in postmenopausal women, due to the hormonal changes taking place.
      After the menopause, the gynoid fat distribution with fat deposits in the gluteo-femoral
      region changes to an android fat distribution with an increased upper body fat, especially
      in the abdominal region. These consequences of the menopause associated with a decrease in
      aerobic capacity and reduced total energy expenditure may lead to the metabolic syndrome
      (MetS). The aim of this study was to investigate the anthropometric, metabolic,
      cardiovascular and symptomatic profile in gynoid and android postmenopausal women.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Postmenopausal women

          -  Caucasian

          -  50-60 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Neurological disease

          -  Pulmonary disease

          -  Cardiac disease

          -  Oncological disease

          -  Musculotendinous or articular injuries

          -  Hormone replacement therapy

          -  Cigarette smoking

study_pop.textblock:
Postmenopausal women from a community sample of São Carlos city - São Paulo State -
        Brazil.

intervention.description: Physiological and biochemical tests; quality of life questionnaire; body composition measurement

facility.name: Optics Group from Physics Institute of São Carlos (IFSC), University of São Paulo (USP)

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Fat Distribution on Metabolic, Cardiovascular and Symptomatic Aspects in Postmenopausal Women

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Physical Therapy, Federal University of São Carlos (UFSCar)
Physics Institute of São Carlos (IFSC), University of São Paulo (USP)
Physics Institute of São Carlos (IFSC), University of São Paulo (USP)
Physics Institute of São Carlos (IFSC), University of São Paulo (USP)

primary_outcome.description: Anthropometric measurements: waist-to-hip ratio and body mass index
primary_outcome.measure: Relationships between postmenopause and fat distribution

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Progressive aerobic testing on treadmill (Modified Bruce Protocol): estimated maximum oxygen consumption; metabolic equivalents; blood pressure; heart rate
secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of aerobic capacity between android and gynoid postmenopausal women

secondary_outcome.description: Biochemical tests: the serum level of estradiol, urea, creatinine, triglycerides, total cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, very low-density lipoprotein (VLDL) cholesterol, insulin and glucose
secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of metabolic parameters between android and gynoid postmenopausal women

secondary_outcome.description: Menopause Rating Scale (MRS): somatic symptoms; psychological symptoms; urogenital-sexual problems
secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of quality of life between android and gynoid postmenopausal women

secondary_outcome.description: Body composition: bipolar electrical bioimpedance (body fat and lean mass) and skinfolds (triceps, subscapular, suprailiac, abdominal, anterior thigh, medial calf)
secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the body composition between android and gynoid postmenopausal women

collaborator.agency: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo
Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
